text.p: Here are highlights of stories in Romania's press on Friday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy:
- An international fair opened in Bucharest with more than 430 local and 231 foreign companies attending.
- Visiting Merrill Lynch economists said enterprise restructuring, trade deficit, foreign debt and non-performing credits were risk factors in Romania.
- The State Ownership Fund (FPS) and the Romanian Development Agency opened a joint Bucharest business centre, seen as a gateway for foreign investors.
- Shell may invest further in Romania by taking over part of the petrol distribution network and possibly refineries.
- The FPS privatised 800 state enterprises so far this year, Prime Minister Victor Ciorbea said when the Fund opened its business centre.
- The FPS plans to open business centres in Barcelona and Madrid, similar to the one recently opened in Bucharest.
- British company Brewing Holding plans to link up with a Romanian brewer in a $8 million project.
